Summary: Wrap SkiaSharp Extended Lottie to play JSON animations with fluent MVU APIs.
Remarks: Use Scaffold to generate a MauiReactor wrapper for SkiaSharp Extended's Lottie view, then control playback (Play, Pause, Loop, Speed) and bind sources (from file, embedded resource, or URL) from component state. The package is preview; prefer simple, state-driven usage for stability.
Example:
<PackageReference Include="Reactor.Maui.ScaffoldGenerator" Version="1.0.74-beta" OutputItemType="Analyzer" ReferenceOutputAssembly="false" />
<PackageReference Include="SkiaSharp.Extended.UI.Maui" Version="2.0.0-preview.61" />

// Scaffold a wrapper (type name depends on package)
[Scaffold(typeof(SkiaSharp.Extended.UI.Maui.Controls.LottieAnimationView))]
partial class LottieAnimationView { }

class LottiePageState
{
    public bool IsPlaying { get; set; } = true;
    public double Speed { get; set; } = 1.0;
}

class LottiePage : Component<LottiePageState>
{
    public override VisualNode Render()
        => new ContentPage
        {
            new VStack(12)
            {
                new LottieAnimationView()
                    // .Source("Resources/Raw/sample.json") // or URL, or embedded resource
                    // .Loop(true)
                    // .Speed(State.Speed)
                    // .IsPlaying(State.IsPlaying)
                ,

                new HStack(8)
                {
                    new Button(State.IsPlaying ? "Pause" : "Play")
                        .OnClicked(() => SetState(s => s.IsPlaying = !s.IsPlaying)),
                    new Button("Speed 2x")
                        .OnClicked(() => SetState(s => s.Speed = 2.0)),
                    new Button("Speed 1x")
                        .OnClicked(() => SetState(s => s.Speed = 1.0))
                }
            }
            .Padding(16)
        };
}
